en: For the shape, cf. CVA, Copenhagen 4, pl. 167, 1, and examples by the Eretria Painter; e.g. Lezzi-Hafter 1988, pls. 146-47. Robinson also compared the style to that of the Eretria Painter, but in fact it seems closer to that of the Calliope Painter; cf. the figures on the pelike Paris, Cab. Md. R 398 (Lezzi-Hafter 1988, pl. 108a-b). In the tondo of a kylix by the Calliope Painter, Boston 21.4, a youth stands before an altar holding what may be an egg; see Lezzi-Hafter 1988, pl. 63a, who calls it a Rauchopfer (ball of incense). On an amphoriskos by the Eretria Painter, Boston 00.355, Eros holds a small chest with four white balls on top, which may be eggs or, as Lezzi-Hafter suggests, fruit; see Lezzi-Hafter 1988, 242, pl. 161).
Broken and repaired. The handle is restored; otherwise intact and in good condition.

A youth wearing a himation and a white fillet is leaning on his staff to the right. With his right hand he proffers a small white object. Facing him at right is a woman in a chiton and himation, whose hair is tied in a chignon with a white fillet. With her right hand she holds out a basket decorated with maeanders. On the ground between the two figures is a small chest decorated with dots and, in the center of one side, a star. On top of the chest is an egg in added white (not a knob, as Robinson suggested). The object held by the youth may therefore also be an egg, but its top is flattened. The giving of eggs, symbols of fertility and birth, had a significance beyond the merely culinary, as it still does in Greece, where eggs are featured in many ceremonies, particularly at Easter. Eggs are common in South Italian vase-painting, particularly Paestan. Robinson's suggestion that the objects may be balls is improbable, as the objects played with by some women are actually balls of wool, taken not from chests but from the kalathoi that are a nearly invariable feature of such scenes; e.g. New York 41.162.147 (ARV2, 733, 62.

Above the figures, at the base of the neck, is a band of tongues. The groundline is a band of egg pattern with dotted interstices. The side of the foot is reserved, and there is a very narrow reserved stripe around the inner edge of the mouth. The rest of the vase is black.
Two grooves on side of foot; cylindrical neck.
